snippet: The Japanese camera maker said that it was seeking almost $50 million from 19 current and former executives, including its current president.
abstract: Olympus says it is suing 19 current and former executives and board members, including its current president, Shuichi Takayama, for $50 million over an accounting scheme to hide losses going back more than a decade; in the latest indication that the scandal is following a distinctly Japanese approach to corporate governance, Olympus will allow Takayama and the implicated board members to stay on until later this year.
lead_paragraph: The Japanese camera maker said that it was seeking almost $50 million from 19 current and former executives, including its current president.

headline.main: Olympus Sues Executives Over Cover-Up, but Does Not Dismiss Them
headline.print_headline: Olympus Sues Executives Over Cover-Up, but Does Not Dismiss Them
